metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11734 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugspresent in Firefox 68. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memorycorruption and we presume that with enough effort that some of these couldbe exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox <69.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11734` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2').
